explanation: Everyone's best friend. It can be held with one or both hands with a good grip and is usually being used in beginner routes

answer: When you complete a problem in your first attempt
explanation: You reach the zone and the top in your first attempt. It requires the climber to both read the route correctly and executed their climb successfully.

answer: When you reach the zone in your first attempt
When you win your first competition

explanation: This amount of time is the average amount of time a climber needs. It differs for each competition, but there usually are fixed time-slots so that a climber can't climb the same problem for hours at a time.

answer: The fastes climber to complete setes the time bar
When the climber reaches the top with both hands, and holds the position for at least 3 seconds
explanation: If you can't hold the position at the top for at least 3 seconds then you haven't completed the problem. Neither one hand only or both hands briefly gets you a score.

answer: When the climber reaches the top with both hands
When the climber reaches the top with one hand
When the climber reaches the zone

explanation: A Slab is a wall that tilts back away from you, and is thus less steep than a vertical. Climbing a Slab wall requires a lot of technique eventhough it looks more easy.

answer: When the climber touches the wall
Only when the zone is reached
When the climber thinks a real attempt has been made
When both feet lift off the mattress
explanation: If a climber touches the wall and both feet a lifted off the mattress, then it is recorded as an attempt. So if only one feet is lifted, then it doesn't count as an attempt.

answer: As many as they want within a fixed time-slot
explanation: This changes from competition to competition. Usually the average time is set to 5 minutes in total, and within that time, they can use as many attempts as they want.

The attempts themselves does not get you a first place ranking, but is based on which climber has solved the most problems, and if there is a tie, then the amount of attempts will be considered, and the one with the fewest attempts wins.
